conclusion: To determine when particles A and B meet, we need to analyze their velocity-time (v-t) graphs and find the time at which the distance traveled by both particles is the same.
The distance traveled by each particle is represented by the area under their respective v-t graphs.
The x-axis represents time \( t \). The y-axis represents velocity \( v \). Particle A has a triangular velocity profile. Particle B has a trapezoidal velocity profile.

premise: Particle A: From \( 0 \) to \( 2t_0 \), the velocity increases linearly from \( 0 \) to \( 2v_0 \). From \( 2t_0 \) to \( 3t_0 \), the velocity decreases linearly from \( 2v_0 \) to \( 0 \).
conclusion: The area under the graph for A is the area of the triangle: \(\text{Area}_A = \frac{1}{2} \times 3t_0 \times 2v_0 = 3t_0v_0\).

premise: Particle B: From \( 0 \) to \( 5t_0 \), the velocity increases linearly from \( 0 \) to \( v_0 \). From \( 5t_0 \) to \( 6t_0 \), the velocity decreases linearly from \( v_0 \) to \( 0 \).
conclusion: The area under the graph for B is the area of the trapezoid: \(\text{Area}_B = \frac{1}{2} \times 11t_0 \times v_0 = 5.5t_0v_0\).

premise: We need to find the time \( t \) when the areas under the curves are equal. Set the areas equal to each other: \(\text{Area}_A = \text{Area}_B\).
conclusion: 3t_0v_0 = 5.5t_0v_0. This equation suggests that the areas are not equal at any point within the given time frames based on the entire graph.

premise: Analyze the graph visually and mathematically to find where the cumulative distance (area under the curve) is the same.
conclusion: From the graph, it appears that the particles meet at \( t = 4t_0 \).

premise: From the graph, it can be seen that at \( t=6t_0 \), the displacements of A and B are equal, and they meet.
conclusion: Particles A and B meet at \( t = 6t_0 \).
